channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Cyclone Ditwah: How Tamil Nadu is gearing up to face storm after it killed over 120 in Sri Lanka
Why are Airbus planes being recalled worldwide? How are Indian airlines affected?
This Week in Explainers: How Arunachal woman’s detention sparked diplomatic spat between India and China
History Today: When the United Nations backed two-state partition in Palestine
You can soon watch movies, live sports on phone without the internet. Here’s how
Parents, sisters, wives, children: Imran Khan’s family tree decoded amid death rumours
How Pakistan’s nuclear-terror nexus enters its most dangerous phase under Munir’s dictatorship
item.description: The world can no longer treat Pakistan’s internal affairs as domestic. The country has entered a perilous era where a single man wields constitutional, military, and nuclear authority, yet he is unbounded by any accountability, law, or restraint

item.title: The grim message behind deadly shootout at Washington
item.description: A shooting just blocks from the White House—one of the most secure locations on the planet—reinforces a grim message: there is no place in the world free from terrorism

item.title: How Japanese hard power diplomacy is on rise
item.description: Japan’s decision to deploy a medium-range missile unit on Yonaguni Island marks a major escalation in its efforts to deter China amid rising tensions over Taiwan and the Indo-Pacific

item.title: How Yunus repeats Khomeini’s playbook to bring Islamist rule in Bangladesh
item.description: Like Khomeini in the weeks before his seizure of power, Bangladesh’s interim leader Mohammad Yunus still speaks about democracy, human rights and justice to visiting diplomats and journalists, but only the most gullible or dishonest among them believe him

item.title: China opens ‘Arctic Express’ route: Need to push Indian maritime corridors
item.description: India must expand Arctic engagement, strengthen maritime capabilities, deepen strategic partnerships, especially with Russia, and leverage new trade corridors to secure its geopolitical and economic interests amid intensifying global competition

item.title: How Pakistan has mastered the art of projecting defeat as victory
item.description: Global military strongmen seeking to overthrow governments and install themselves as dictators must learn from Pakistan’s playbook on how to falsely project defeat as victory
